title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: deserted Minto Street to Queen's Crescent with Jean's hand in hers to grip hold of at each contraction, there came five hours of pain and then exhaustion, followed by more pain and more

title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: the Queen's Crescent nursing home and the doctor's notes, the detested contract she'd signed and the various other forms Mrs Saunders had made her complete. Her own details were also included: Jean's bakery address had been scored out and replaced by Glengyle Terrace.

title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: Standing with one hand resting on her hip and staring flatly across the room, she reminded Maggie of a rather squat and angry-looking petrol pump. 'Queen's Crescent?' There was a swift jerk of her head in the direction of the far corner.

title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: 'Thank you, Miss Davies, and speaking on behalf of everyone here at Woodstock House, let me say how much we all look forward to welcoming your newborn child and to caring for him. We have the address in Queen's Crescent and will see to all the arrangements.' She stood up.
